name: v0.3.1
body: Publish to npm with automated workflow.
Bundles system (core, agents, ops, evaluation)
Health reports and facets
Site build pipeline
Schema validation improvements

name: v1.0.2 — Stability & Hardening
body: AST-based analysis**: Complexity scoring and injection detection now use real AST walks instead of string counting/regex
Deterministic builds**: `uv.lock` committed, CI uses `uv sync --frozen`, lock-drift check prevents silent dep changes
Build smoke test**: Every push builds a wheel, installs in a clean env, and verifies imports work
Repo governance**: CODEOWNERS, issue/PR templates, Dependabot (pip + GitHub Actions, weekly)
Single-source versioning**: `__version__` reads from `importlib.metadata`, test enforces parity with `pyproject.toml`
`confidence` field renamed to `signal_strength` on all suggestion/issue dataclasses — **backward compatible**: `to_dict()` still emits both keys, `@property` aliases preserved

name: v2.0.3
body: `categorize_tool()` now falls back to description matching when name has no category keywords
`analytics.last_success_at` stores real timestamps instead of the literal string "CURRENT_TIMESTAMP"
`SyncEmbedder` no longer crashes when called from inside a running event loop (Gradio, FastMCP)
UI `run_async` helper replaced with deterministic loop detection (no more `RuntimeError` roulette)
Removed discarded `sequence_hash` read in chain detection
Private `_backends` dict access replaced with public `is_backend_connected()` API

name: v1.0.0 - Streaming Prosody Engine
body: All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.
Deterministic Prosody Engine**: Core DSP logic for expressivity control.
Micro-Timing Control**: Sub-millisecond precision for rhythm and duration.
Streaming Architecture**: Low-latency audio processing pipeline.
Reference Handbook**: Comprehensive guide to vocology and prosody concepts.
`voice-engine-dsp`: Primary DSP package.

name: v2.5.0 — MCP Integration & Agent Interoperability
body: Voice Soundboard v2.5.0 — the agent bridge release.
MCP Server** — embedded MCP-compliant server with tool registration, WebSocket transport, and configurable concurrency
Core Tools** — `voice.speak`, `voice.stream`, `voice.interrupt`, `voice.list_voices`, `voice.status`
Agent Sessions** — session-scoped synthesis with agent ownership and priority-based interruption
Streaming Interrupts** — structured interrupt handling with fade-out and rollback points
Observability** — synthesis metadata with latency, duration, cost estimates, and cache hit tracking

name: v0.1.0
body: A token-based lease governor for AI calls — small enough to embed anywhere, strict enough to prevent stampedes.
Concurrency control** — weighted slots with interactive reserve
Rate limiting** — requests/min and tokens/min with rolling windows
Fairness** — prevent actor monopolization with soft caps
Adaptive tuning** — auto-adjust concurrency from deny rate and latency
Leases** — acquire before, release after, auto-expire on timeout

name: v0.4.0-alpha.0 — Optional Adapters
body: Five adapters for common AI integration patterns, all living in separate subpath exports for tree-shaking.
| Adapter | Import | Description |
| **fetch** | `throttleai/adapters/fetch` | Wraps any `fetch`-compatible function |
| **OpenAI** | `throttleai/adapters/openai` | Wraps `openai.chat.completions.create` with token estimation |
| **Tool** | `throttleai/adapters/tools` | Wraps any async function (embeddings, rerankers, etc.) |

name: v0.3.0-alpha.0 — Usability & DX
body: Presets** — `presets.quiet()`, `presets.balanced()`, `presets.aggressive()` return opinionated `GovernorConfig` objects. Spreadable and overridable.
`snapshot()`** — `gov.snapshot()` returns a read-only view of current state (concurrency, rate pools, flags). Print a one-line health status from any monitoring loop.
`onEvent` hook** — Optional `GovernorEventHandler` fires structured events on `acquire` / `deny` / `release` / `expire` / `warn`. No logging by default — you decide.
Better deny guidance** — `recommendation` strings now include concrete numbers (slot counts, rate usage, actor IDs, retry timing).
`waitForRetry()` + `retryAcquire()`** — Retry helpers: `waitForRetry(decision)` sleeps for `retryAfterMs`, `retryAcquire(gov, req, { maxAttempts })` wraps acquire with automatic retry.
Strict mode** — `strict: true` catches dev mistakes: double release → error, unknown leaseId → error, long-held leases (>80% TTL) → warn event.

name: v0.2.0-alpha.0 — Phase 2: Smarter Decisions
body: 5 commits that make the governor's decisions more intelligent without changing the API surface or adding runtime dependencies.
Better retryAfter** — computed, not heuristic
Concurrency denial retryAfterMs derived from earliest lease expiry
Rate denial retryAfterMs computed from rolling window math
All values clamped to [25ms, 5000ms] via `clampRetry()`
Weighted concurrency** — `estimate.weight`

name: LeaseGate Lite v0.1.0
body: Smooths local AI workload bursts so your PC stays responsive during heavy usage.
Applies practical throughput controls (concurrency, adaptive throttling, rate limits) with sensible defaults.
Gives you clear, auditable visibility through live status, event trail, diagnostics export, and in-app audit harness.
It does **not** upload prompts or call external telemetry services by default.
It does **not** act as cloud orchestration or multi-host fleet management.
It does **not** replace your model runtime; it only governs local request pressure and pacing.

name: v1.0.0 — Shared Content System Core
body: Portable, local-first content ingestion + normalization + indexing for **Dev-Op-Typer** (Windows) and **linux-dev-typer** (Linux).
Deterministic language detection** — 3-tier: user choice > file extension > heuristic fallback
Normalization** — UTF-8 (lossy fallback), LF-only line endings, append trailing newline
Metrics** — `lines`, `characters`, `symbolDensity` (29-char frozen set incl `"` and `'`), `maxIndentDepth`
Content-addressed IDs** — SHA-256(language + normalized code), stable across platforms
Deduplicated, deterministically ordered index** — by language then title

name: v1.2.0 - Enhanced Vortex Rendering
body: Catmull-Rom Spline Smoothing**
Trajectory paths now render with smooth, organic curves instead of jagged line segments. Each segment is interpolated with 8 subdivisions for fluid motion.
Adaptive Stroke Width**
Line thickness now varies inversely with velocity - faster motion creates thinner strokes, slower motion creates thicker strokes. Like calligraphy, this adds natural visual rhythm to the trajectory.
Trail Opacity Decay**
Older trajectory points fade naturally, with recent path emphasized. The fade starts at 40% opacity and increases toward the current position, making it easy to see temporal progression.

name: v1.1.0 - Zero-Warning Build & Complete Crash Recovery
body: Session Recovery**: Full crash recovery now restores playback position, current page, and playback state
Automatically reloads the file that was open when the app crashed
Resumes playback from exact position
Navigates to the page you were viewing
Zero-Warning Build**: Eliminated all 11 compiler warnings
CS0108: Added \

name: synthesis v0.1.0
body: Deterministic engine that composes behavioral constraints and interaction signals into coherent response strategies.
Synthesis avoids emotion modeling, focusing on auditable rules:
Preserving agency
Avoiding false reassurance
Maintaining presence
Repair after failure

name: v0.3.1 - Polish & Guardrails
body: Pure ergonomics release. No new features, no API changes—just making FlexiFlow more pleasant to use.
Before:
```python
from flexiflow.engine import FlexiFlowEngine
from flexiflow.component import AsyncComponent
from flexiflow.state_machine import StateMachine, State

name: v0.3.0 - Composition & Ergonomics
body: This release improves embedding, configuration composition, and production persistence—without breaking existing configs.
State Packs**: Register multiple custom states via `states:` mapping in config
SQLite Persistence**: Production-ready adapter with history + retention (`prune_snapshots_sqlite`)
Namespaced tables**: `flexiflow_snapshots` avoids collisions in shared databases
Complete embedded app example in `examples/embedded_app/`
Cookbook section with embedded usage pattern

name: v0.2.0
body: Custom state loading via dotted paths** (`pkg.mod:ClassName`)
Auto-registration and normalization to class name
No core edits required for custom states
Observability hooks** via structured events
`component.message.received` - fires when message is handled
`state.changed` - fires on state transition with from/to states

name: Pathway Core v0.1.0
body: An append-only journey engine where undo never erases learning.**
14 event types** covering the full journey lifecycle
SQLite event store** with thread-safe concurrent writes and atomic seq assignment
Three derived views**: Journey, Learned, Artifacts
FastAPI endpoints** with security baseline
CLI tools** including `doctor` command for health checks

name: Tool-Scan v1.0.0
body: The first dedicated security scanner for MCP (Model Context Protocol) tool definitions.
Security Threat Detection**: Prompt injection, tool poisoning, command injection, SQL injection, XSS, SSRF, data exfiltration
MCP Compliance**: Full validation against MCP specification 2025-11-25
Unified Scoring**: 1-100 score with letter grades (A+ to F)
Actionable Remarks**: Specific recommendations for improving tool security
CI/CD Ready**: Exit codes and JSON output for automation

name: v0.2.0 - Headless GitHub Operations
body: This release adds a comprehensive GitHub module for fully scriptable CI/CD operations. Manage releases, PRs, issues, and workflows without ever touching the web UI.
```bash
hwb github release v1.0.0 --repo owner/repo --files dist/*.whl
hwb github workflow run build.yml --repo owner/repo --ref main
hwb github pr create --repo owner/repo --head feature --base main \
title "Add new feature" --body "Description here"

A/B Voice Comparison** - Compare two preset configurations side-by-side

Export Options** - Download as WAV, MP3, or OGG
Preset Folders & Tags** - Organize custom presets
Voice science parameters for natural humanization:

name: v0.6.2 - Beta Release: Lossless Context Restoration
body: > **Never lose your LLM context again.**
We're excited to announce the first beta release of Context Window Manager - an MCP server that provides **true, lossless context restoration** for LLM sessions.

Every LLM developer knows the pain: you're deep in a complex conversation, the context is rich with understanding, and then... you hit the token limit. Traditional solutions summarize or truncate, **losing valuable information forever**.
Context Window Manager takes a different approach: we capture and persist the actual KV cache tensors, allowing you to **freeze** your context and **thaw** it later with zero information loss.
Freeze & Thaw**: Save context snapshots and restore them exactly as they were
Clone & Branch**: Fork contexts for parallel exploration without losing the original

name: v0.1.0 - Initial Release
body: A universal, headless Python wheel builder for local paths, git repos, and CI/CD pipelines.
Build from Anywhere** - Local directories, GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket repos, archive URLs, monorepos
PEP 517/518/621 Compliant** - Works with setuptools, hatchling, flit, poetry, maturin, and more
Build Isolation** - Choose between fast venv isolation or Docker containers for manylinux/musllinux wheels
Multi-Registry Publishing** - PyPI, TestPyPI, private registries, or S3-compatible storage
Automated Versioning** - Semantic versioning with Conventional Commits integration

```python
from voice_soundboard.engines import F5TTSEngine
engine = F5TTSEngine()

name: Voice Soundboard v0.1.0 - Initial Release

50+ High-Quality Voices** - Powered by Kokoro ONNX with diverse accents and styles
Real-Time Streaming** - Instant playback as audio generates, no waiting
SSML Support** - Fine-grained control with pauses, emphasis, and prosody
Emotional Speech** - 8 emotional tones: happy, sad, angry, surprised, and more
Sound Effects** - 13 built-in effects: chimes, alerts, ambient sounds
